item.title: Malia Obama is spotted smiling and chatting with her posh British boyfriend who enjoys a cigarette in New York
item.description: Former First Daughter Malia Obama and her British beau, Rory Farquharson, both 19 and at Harvard University, enjoyed an afternoon in each other's company in New York city.
item.dc:abstract: Former First Daughter Malia Obama and her British beau, Rory Farquharson, both 19 and at Harvard University, enjoyed an afternoon in each other's company in New York city. Farquharson first entered the media spotlight, when he was caught passionately kissing President Barack Obama's eldest daughter before a Harvard-Yale football game in November. Malia, 19, who took a gap year before starting at Harvard this fall, met her sophomore boyfriend at their Ivy League university.

item.title: Mylee's last treat: Brother of SAS TV star posted picture of daughter, eight, eating pizza less than an HOUR before 'knifing her to death'
item.description: A 54-year-old man has been arrested after an eight-year-old girl was stabbed to death in Brownhills, near Walsall, West Midlands Police said. The man was also treated for stab wounds.
item.dc:abstract: A father arrested for the murder of his eight-year-old daughter in the West Midlands posted a picture of her on Facebook just an hour before police were called. Bill Billingham (top right), 54, has been named by locals after his eight-year-old daughter, Mylee was found with knife wounds on Saturday night in Valley View in Brownhills near Walsall. He is understood to have been taken to hospital last night with stab wounds to the stomach, and is set to be questioned in due course. An hour before police arrived at 9.15pm, the father posted a picture of his daughter on Facebook (main image) at 8.15pm eating pizza on a bed with the caption:'Pitza on bed lv moo x'. The murder suspect's brother Mark Billingham MBE (pictured bottom right, with the suspect) is one of the stars of Channel 4's SAS Who Dares Wins and was once a private body guard for Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie and Tom Cruise.
item.dc:creator: Gareth Davies
item.mi:shortTitle: Dad posts picture of daughter, 8, before 'knifing her to death'

item.description: California House of Horrors investigators are reportedly planning to bring in cadaver dogs to see if there are other siblings who didn't survive.
item.dc:abstract: Homicide detectives are considering sending cadaver dogs into the David and Louise's house of horrors, according to a new report. Riverside County Sheriff's Homicide Detectives want to see if there were other children who might not have survived. Citing sources familiar with the investigation, the show is also reporting that the detectives may want to order DNA testing on the 13 Turpin siblings, seven adults and six children to confirm that they are related. This information was not confirmed by the Sheriff's Department.

item.title: Newlyweds are TRAPPED in a house they cannot sell due to legal catch that means their ground rent doubles EVERY decade
item.description: Newlyweds Nathan and Tasha Stewart were devastated to discover a legal catch in their lease which has left them unable to sell their Soham home which they bought together in 2014.
item.dc:abstract: A young couple have been left devastated after discovering a legal catch in their lease which has left them unable to sell their house. Newlyweds Nathan and Tasha Stewart were horrified to discover that their leasehold agreement has a clause which means the ground rent doubles every decade. The pair bought the property built by housebuilders Taylor Wimpey in Lion Mills, a development in Soham, in 2014. But when they tried to sell up in October last year, 27-year-old marketing manager Nathan came across the game-changing clause.
item.dc:creator: Phoebe Southworth

item.title: Sparkle is the new black! Halle Berry shimmers in a sequined gown while Margot Robbie, Nicole Kidman and Allison Williams shine too as color returns to the red carpet at the Screen Actors Guild Awards
item.description: The women turned the red carpet black at the Golden Globes, as they united for Times Up. But with their point made, the sparkle returned for the 24th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards.
item.dc:abstract: The women of Hollywood turned the red carpet black at the Golden Globes, as they united in support of the Times Up movement. But with their point made, the sparkle returned on Sunday night, as the stars dug out their sequins and glitter for the 24th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards at The Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles. Two weeks after they shunned color in a protest against sexual harassment in Hollywood and beyond, Halle Berry, Margot Robbie, Nicole Kidman and Allison Williams led the way in their bright, shimmering gowns.

item.description: Two men have been taken to hospital after they were stabbed at a shopping centre in Luton. Pictures posted onto social media show a trail of blood through the shopping centre.
item.dc:abstract: Shoppers watched on in horror as two men were stabbed at a busy mall in Luton. Grisly pictures show a trail of blood and a large knife lying on the floor of the shopping centre and Bedfordshire Police said the two men had been taken to hospital. Their condition is unknown. Officers were called to The Mall at around 2.30pm on Sunday afternoon and the shopping centre is cordoned off while the probe takes place.

item.title: 'The song has ended, but the memories linger on': Hundreds of fans, friends and family gather in the Irish home town of Dolores O'Riordan to pay their respects after The Cranberries singer died at 46
item.description: Fans young and old, holding floral tributes, are visiting St Joseph's Church (pictured) in Limerick to pay their respects to O'Riordan whose open coffin is resting at the altar.
item.dc:abstract: Fans young and old visited St Joseph's Church in the city to pay their respects to O'Riordan, whose coffin is resting at the altar (right). Large crowds lined the road outside for most of the afternoon as they waited patiently to get into the church (shown top left), with one floral tribute reading: 'The song had ended but the memories linger on' (bottom left). O'Riordan's distinctive voice filled the church as her songs were softly played throughout the service, while photographs of the singer performing and one of her with the Pope were placed along the walls. The Irish singer (inset) was found dead in a London hotel on January 15, aged 46. The public reposal is the first in a series of services to be held before the funeral mass taking place in the Church of Saint Ailbe in Ballybricken, Co Limerick, on Tuesday at 11.30am.
item.dc:creator: Alex Matthews

item.title: 'There was blood everywhere': Woman dies after falling from her balcony on a Carnival cruise and landing several decks below - a year after man, 24, died when he fell overboard the same ship
item.description: The woman, who has not yet been identified, died early Friday morning on the Carnival Elation (file photo), which was traveling from Jacksonville, Florida to Freeport in The Bahamas.
item.dc:abstract: The woman, who has not yet been identified, died early Friday morning on the Carnival Elation (file photo), which was traveling from Jacksonville, Florida to Freeport in The Bahamas. 'There was blood everywhere,' a woman on board texted her mother, who then told the Miami Herald. In the past year, Carnival has seen three death-by-falling incidents. Zion Smith, 8, fell off the fifth-story deck of Glory while the ship was docked at a Miami port in October 2017. And in February 2017, Kevin Wellons of Georgia fell from the 11th-floor deck of the Elation into the water while the ship was near the Bahamas.
item.dc:creator: Forrest Hanson

item.title: Billionaire couple who were found hanging in their Toronto home were MURDERED by multiple killers and the wife may have put up a fight, private investigators conclude
item.description: Barry and Honey Sherman were believed to have died as a result of a murder-suicide, but a source told CBC Toronto that private investigators doubt that. Both murders are being looked at differently.
item.dc:abstract: Barry and Honey Sherman (center) were believed to have died as a result of a murder-suicide, but a source told CBC Toronto that private investigators doubt that. A real estate agent found Barry and Honey - 75 and 70-years-old - dead in the basement of their Toronto mansion on December 15. The PI found that both victims had their necks wrapped with leather belts. It is also believed by the PIs that Honey struggled because she had cuts on her lip and nose and was sitting in a pool (top right) of her own blood.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Wright

item.title: Alexis Sanchez arrives at Manchester United's Carrington training ground by private jet ahead of his medical
item.description: Alexis Sanchez took a private jet and landed at Manchester airport on Sunday ahead of completing the final details of his move from Arsenal, a swap deal with Henrikh Mhkitaryan.
item.dc:abstract:
Alexis Sanchez has arrived at Manchester United's Carrington training ground for his medical.
Sanchez took a private jet and landed at Manchester airport on Sunday ahead of completing the final details of his move from Arsenal, a swap deal with Henrikh Mhkitaryan. The 29-year-old forward posted a video of himself about to board the jet in an Instagram story before his plane was pictured arriving at Manchester airport. He was then pictured arriving in the back of a car at Carrington, where he has an appointment with United's medical staff.

item.title: Snow hits London and floods strike in Devon after Britain freezes in coldest night for TWO years with temperatures plummeting below -13C
item.description: Shoppers wrapped up in scarves huddled under umbrellas as they walked along Oxford Street, with snow also falling across the Home Counties, as Britons braced themselves against wintry conditions.
item.dc:abstract: Shoppers huddled under umbrellas and jumped in taxis to escape the snow on Oxford Street (bottom left), with flurries also falling across the Home Counties and the West Midlands (top right), as Britons braced themselves against wintry conditions. Temperatures dropped dramatically overnight, with a low of -13.5C recorded in the Scottish Highlands (bottom right), while freezing temperatures were recorded as far south as London Luton Airport. The Met Office has updated a yellow 'be aware' warning of snow and ice to cover much of Scotland, north Wales and England down to southern parts.

item.title: 'Jihadi bride' arrested at Heathrow with her baby then bailed is the first to return to UK with a child born under ISIS in Syria
item.description: The unnamed woman, 27, arrived on a flight from Addis Ababa and was arrested by counter-terror officers as British police face an influx of jihadi brides like Glaswegian Aqsa Mahmood (pictured).
item.dc:abstract: The woman, 27, whose identity has not been revealed arrived on a flight from Addis Ababa and was arrested on suspicion of preparation of terrorist acts under section 5 of the Terrorist Act 2006. MI5 has previously said around 850 extremists from Britain travelled to the Middle East as ISIS took control of pockets of Syria and Iraq. And as the terror group is flushed out of its former strongholds, many of its militants with British passports are returning home with their families. The mother is the latest in a string of arrests made by British counter-terror police bracing itself for an influx of jihadi brides. Among the blacklisted British citizens still thought to be living within ISIS territory are Aqsa Mahmood (right), a Glaswegian who went to Syria to marry an ISIS fighter aged 20, and London-born Muslim convert Grace Dare (inset), whose ISIS husband Abu Bakr has since been killed. Tania Joya (left) - British ex-wife of a top US ISIS member -stunned Piers Morgan during a tense TV interview this week by admitting she still loves the jihadist and insisting he 'has a good side'.

item.mi:shortTitle: 'Jihadi bride' arrested at Heathrow with her baby then bailed

item.title: He is sale-ing! Rod Stewart slashes price of his 26-acre estate by £1m in bid to interest buyers
item.description: Sir Rod Stewart, 73, has taken drastic measures to sell his Essex mansion, slashing the price of the grade-II listed property by £1million. He is now selling the luxury home in Epping for £5.95million.
item.dc:abstract: Rod Stewart (pictured inset) has taken drastic measures to sell his Essex mansion, slashing the price by £1million. He once said he was going to live there 'for the rest of his life' but Sir Rod Stewart put the grade-II listed property up for sale in July 2016 for £7.5million. But by November that year he had cut the price of the 25-acre Wood House estate in Epping (aerial shot pictured) by £550,000. Now he has slashed the price tag even more to £5.95million - still much more than the £1.2million he paid for the mansion in 1986.

item.title: The One You've All Been Waiting For? Fans go crazy over a viral 'trailer for a new Friends movie' with Joey, Chandler and the gang hitting 50
item.description: On Friday a trailer surfaced on YouTube that made it seem like that the Friends gang might finally be reuniting 14 years later. But unfortunately, the trailer is a hoax.
item.dc:abstract: A new trailer allegedly for a Friends movie circulated on the internet over the weekend - sending fans into an excited flurry wondering, could it be? Since the show that started Jennifer Aniston's career went off the air in 2004 - fans have been hoping it would return for reunion season or movie - like Sex and the City did in 2008. And on Friday a trailer surfaced on YouTube that made it seem like that might finally be happening 14 years later. Fans reacted enthusiastically to the news on social media over the weekend - with many questioning if it was real but expressing their excitement regardless. But unfortunately, the trailer is a hoax.

item.title: Oxford University extends time for maths and computer science exams in bid to help women get better grades
item.description: Oxford undergraduates were given 105 minutes to complete papers, rather than 90, without a change in difficulty or length, with female students doing better as a result.
item.dc:abstract: Undergraduates were given 105 minutes to complete their papers, rather 90. There was no change in difficulty or the length of questions and female students were said to do better as a result. Dons trialed the changes to allow women to achieve higher results, with just seven female maths finalists achieving firsts last year compared with 45 men.

item.title: Natalie Portman tells LA Women's March she experienced 'sexual terrorism' at 13 after starring in her first film when a fan sent her a 'rape fantasy' and critics 'talked about my budding breasts'
item.description: Portman shared the traumatic experience Saturday while speaking to a crowd of thousands of women at the Los Angeles Women's March.
item.dc:abstract: Natalie Portman said that at the age of 13, after starring in her first film, she experienced 'sexual terrorism' from fans and the media that impacted the way she went about the rest of her career. Portman shared the traumatic experience Saturday while speaking to a crowd of thousands of women at the Los Angeles Women's March. The award-winning actress explained that she turned 12 on the set of her first film, 'The Professional,' in which she played a young girl who made friends with a hit man in hopes of avenging her parents' murders. When the movie was released a year later, she said she was excited to open her first fan letter. But inside the letter a man had written to her about a 'rape fantasy' he had about her.

item.dc:abstract: I hear that Prince Harry, who counts Obama as a friend, won't ask the former Democrat U.S. President to his nuptials at St George's Chapel, Windsor Castle, on May 19. 'President Trump will not be invited because the wedding will be for friends and family only,' a source tells me. It won't be a state occasion. item.description: The IRA plotted to murder Princes Margaret for calling the Irish 'pigs' during an official tour to the US in 1979 a new biography has revealed.
item.dc:abstract: The IRA plotted to murder Princes Margaret for calling the Irish 'pigs' a new biography has revealed. The Queen's sister became a target for the terrorist group after she made the derogatory comment during an official visit to the US in October 1979. Princess Margaret was at a reception in Chicago discussing the recent assassination by the IRA of her cousin Lord Mountbatten with the city's mayor Jane Byrne.

item.description: Justin Cheng was a third-year student at the University of Bristol's Law School. He was found on January 12. He is the eighth Bristol student to take his own life in 18 months.
item.dc:abstract: A student is thought to have taken his own life in the eighth reported case at a Bristol university in 18 months. Justin Cheng was a third-year student at the University of Bristol's Law School. He was found on the evening of Friday, January 12. Mark Ames, director of student services at the university, confirmed the news on Sunday night.
item.dc:creator: Keiran Southern

item.title: Apache helicopter pilots become the first active-duty same-sex couple to marry at West Point
item.description: Daniel Hall, 30 (at left in all three photos) and VIncent Franchino, 26 (right) were married at the Cadet Chapel at the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York.
item.dc:abstract: Daniel Hall, 30 (at left in all three photos) and VIncent Franchino, 26 (right) were married at the Cadet Chapel at the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York. Their exchange of vows is believed to be the first active-duty, same-sex marriage at the military school. The captains, who are now stationed together at Fort Bliss in Texas, were married in front of 150 family members and friends, 34 of whom were military officers.

item.description: The cast of Home And Away have attended the funeral of actress Jessica Falkholt ten days after her life support was turned off.
item.dc:abstract: The cast of Home And Away attended the funeral of actress Jessica Falkholt ten days after she died. Hundreds of family members, friends and TV stars packed out St Mary's Catholic Church at Ryde, in Sydney, on Monday to say farewell to Jessica (inset bottom), who had her life support switched off following a car accident that killed her parents, Lars, 69 and Vivian, 60, and sister Annabelle, 21. The 28-year-old found fame on the small screen as Hope Morrison on TV soap Home and Away. Past and present stars of the show including Pia Miller (pictured right, hugging Olivia Deeble, who is also pictured top inset), Jackson Heywood and Janet King actress Andrea Demetriades were seen exiting the church together. Left: Her coffin being carried out of the church during the emotional service.

item.dc:abstract: Matt Lauer has allegedly been kicked out of his Hamptons home by his wife, months after multiple women came forward to accuse the disgraced anchor of inappropriate sexual behavior. Annette Roque, who Lauer has been married to for 19 years, forced him out of the estate where they live with their three children over the weekend, according to Page Six. A source close to the family said Lauer is staying at a home nearby so he can be close to the two kids who still live at home. His oldest son attends a boarding prep school. Lauer was fired from his $250million yearly gig at The Today Show in late November after he was accused of inappropriate sexual conduct in the workplace. Shortly after he released a statement saying he was 'truly sorry'.

item.title: Chilling photo shows white supremacist who 'killed his gay male Ivy league friend' acting out brutal 'skull crushing' scene by a neo-Nazi character in the movie American History X
item.description: A chilling photo has surfaced showing white supremacist Samuel Woodward, who is suspected of killing Jewish Ivy League student Blaze Bernstein, pretending to 'curb stomp' a friend's skull
item.dc:abstract: A chilling photo has surfaced showing the white supremacist, who is suspected of killing a Jewish Ivy League student, pretending to 'curb stomp' a friend's skull in a reenactment of a brutal scene from a film involving neo-Nazis. In the undated picture, which was originally posted on the social media app iFunny, Samuel Woodward, 20 (top right), can be seen smiling, standing above a friend who is on the ground with his face pressed against a yellow parking barrier. Woodward's right foot is raised and hovering just inches above the friend's head, as if about to execute a 'curb stomp' - a violent act that results in severe facial injuries and even death in victims - which entered pop culture after being depicted in the movie American History X, which starred Edward Norton as a neo-Nazi. According to the New York Post, the photo was among those posted under Woodward's since-deleted iFunny account, 'Saboteur,' which he is said to have used to further his white supremacist and neo-Nazi ideology. Authorities say that Woodward, of Newport Beach, California, allegedly murdered his one-time high school classmate, Blaze Bernstein (bottom right) in early January.
item.dc:creator: NY Freelance
item.mi:shortTitle: White supremacist who 'killed gay male friend' posted 'curb stomp' pic

item.title: 'I felt like a burns victim': Woman, 35, left with horrific burns and agonising blisters after using Banana Boat 50+ sunscreen - and fears she could now get skin cancer

item.dc:abstract: Sarah Madden (top right), 35, said doctors told her she will need regular melanoma skin checks for the rest of her life after suffering second degree burns (bottom right and left) during a holiday on the Sunshine Coast. Ms Madden claims she slathered 'a very thick layer' of Banana Boat 'sport' 50+ suncream (inset) all over her skin 30 minutes before heading to a popular beach last month. But despite reapplying after getting out of the water, she claims the skin on her back erupted with massive fluid-filled blisters which needed hospital treatment – and is still scarlet three weeks later. Banana Boat have apologised to Sarah but said customers can be reassured their products provide 'safe and effective sun protection'.

item.description: Oakley Hallam-Baker, 2, suffered agonising third-degree burns when he tipped his teacher's drink over himself during supervised play time at Chapel Day Nursery in Bournemouth.
item.dc:abstract: Oakley's mother Tracey Hallam-Baker (both pictured left), 33, described how she arrived at the £50-a-day Chapel Day Nursery in Bournemouth (inset) to find her son, two, screaming in pain, with his burns (right) wrapped in a fluffy blanket when they should have been under cold water. He was in so much agony he had to be given morphine when he arrived at Poole Hospital. Mrs Hallam-Baker, a compliance officer at financial services firm JP Morgan, claimed paramedics were shocked by his treatment and urged her and her husband Ricky to take action against the nursery over the incident on April 1, 2015. Last week Bournemouth and Poole County Court agreed the nursery should pay the family £4,300.

item.title: New England Patriots book their place at Super Bowl LII as Tom Brady inspires ANOTHER fourth quarter comeback - and Gisele's reaction is priceless!
item.description: Tom Brady led the New England Patriots into yet another Super Bowl after a heroic comeback in the fourth quarter against the Jacksonville Jaguars.
item.dc:abstract: Tom Brady led the New England Patriots into yet another Super Bowl after a heroic comeback in the fourth quarter against the Jacksonville Jaguars. The Patriots appeared to have run out of luck as they entered the final quarter down 20-10, but two touchdowns from Danny Amendola from Brady passes saw them edge the AFC Championship game 24-20. The Jaguars - who entered the game as eight-point underdogs - looked like they might cling on to victory, until Amendola scraped over the line in with less than three minutes left on the clock. For the Jaguars the fairy tale is now over, but Brady and the Patriots will look to retain their title as they travel to Minnesota for Super Bowl LII on February 4. There they will meet either the Minnesota Vikings on their home turf, or the Philadelphia Eagles depending on the result of this evening's NFC Championship game.
